treatment.description: Trees to 50 m; trunk to 4 m diam. Bark usually dark reddish brown to light brown with shallow furrows. Branchlets mostly with leaves in 2 ranks, pendent to horizontally spreading. Leaves mostly narrowly linear, ca. 5--17 mm, laterally divergent, free portion contracted and twisted basally. 2 n = 22.
treatment.discussion: This variety and var. mexicanum exhibit continuous morphologic integradation and are distinguished on the basis of phenology and distribution.
treatment.habitat: Brownwater rivers, lake margins, and swamps, occasionally in slightly brackish water
